content.title: Sneha Sparsha
content.department: Dept. of Health & Family Welfare, Govt. of Assam
content.beneficiary: Children below 12 years of age affected with serious ailments
content.details: Launched on 30th December 2021, the 'Sneha Sparsha' is a healthcare scheme that provides financial assistance for specialized treatment of children below 12 years of age affected with serious ailments. Families with annual income less than ₹ 2,50,000 shall be eligible for availing benefits under the scheme, while priority shall be given to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.
benefits: Bone Marrow Transplant: Financial assistance up to ₹ 10,00,000 per case.
Cochlear Implant: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 5,35,000 for BPL beneficiaries and ₹ 3,00,000 for APL beneficiaries.
Liver Transplant: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 16,00,000 for BPL beneficiaries and ₹ 10,00,000 for APL beneficiaries.
Kidney Transplant: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 3,00,000 for BPL beneficiaries and ₹ 2,00,000 for APL beneficiaries.
Artificial Limb: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 1,00,000 for Cosmetic Limbs and up to ₹ 2,50,000 for Motorized Artificial Limb.
Blood Cancer: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 1,00,000 per case.
Specialized Eye Surgery: Financial assistance of ₹ 15,000.
Tumors: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 25,000 for investigations and treatment, and up to ₹ 50,000 for surgery.
Neurological Anomalies: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 50,000.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a child below 12 years of age.
The beneficiary should be a resident of the state of Assam.
The beneficiary should be affected by some serious ailment(s).
The annual income of the family of the beneficiary should be less than ₹ 5,00,000, with priority given to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.
content.application_process: Online applications must be submitted to the Office of the Mission Director and/or to the Sneha Sparsha Committee, Sneha Sparsha C/o Gauhati Medical College. Applicants must appear before the Sneha Sparsha Committee with the patient on an appointed date for document verification.
documents_required: Residential Proof / Domicile Certificate of Assam
Photograph of the Patient (Attested by Doctor)
OPD Advice Slip / Discharge Summary / Prescription

faqs.question: When Was The 'Sneha Sparsha' Scheme Announced?
faqs.answer: The 'Sneha Sparsha' was announced on 30th December 2021.

faqs.question: Which Department Launched The 'Sneha Sparsha' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Sneha Sparsha' scheme was launched by the Dept. of Health & Family Welfare, Govt. of Assam.

faqs.question: Who Are The Target Beneficiaries Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is provided for specialized treatment of children below 12 years of age affected with serious ailments.

faqs.question: Is There Any Reservation/Preference/Priority In The Selection Of The Beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Families with annual income less than ₹ 5,00,000 shall be eligible, with priority given to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance In The Case Of A Bone Marrow Transplant?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance up to ₹ 10,00,000 per case.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance In The Case Of Blood Cancer?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of up to ₹ 1,00,000 per case.

faqs.question: Will The Cost Of Travel And Stay For Obtaining Treatment Be Borne By The Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the cost of travel and stay will not be borne by the Scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance In The Case Of A Kidney Transplant?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance up to ₹ 3,00,000 for BPL beneficiaries and ₹ 2,00,000 for APL beneficiaries.

faqs.question: To Whom Should The Application For The 'Sneha Sparsha' Scheme Be Submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications should be submitted to the Office of the Mission Director and/or to the Sneha Sparsha Committee.
